name: Purslane Salad With Mushrooms, Walnuts and Olives
description: One of the things I like best about these greens is that they’re good cooked or uncooked. The leaves of dandelions and amaranth are quite tough, so if they are to be used in a salad, they should be cut in very thin ribbons, or chiffonade. Cooking diminishes their bitterness and gives endives a velvety texture that I love. This crunchy salad is about as high in omega-3 fats as a salad can be.
keywords: gluten-free, halal, healthy, kosher, low-carb, low cholesterol, low-sodium, low sugar, vegetarian, mushroom, purslane
recipeIngredient: 1 generous bunch purslane, thick stems cut away (about 4 cups), washed and dried
6 medium-size cremini or white mushrooms, wiped clean, trimmed and sliced
1/3 cup thinly sliced celery (from the heart of the celery)
1 tablespoon red wine vinegar, white wine vinegar, or sherry vinegar
1 garlic clove, green shoot removed, minced or pureed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the purslane, mushrooms, celery, celery leaves, walnuts, olives and feta in a large salad bowl.
Whisk together the vinegar, lemon juice, garlic, salt, olive oil and pepper. Toss with the salad and serve.
